Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Jar
Description: Jar with an ovoid bottom, tall paracylindrical neck, unrestricted mouth and simple lip. The common clay, buff-coloured, fine and compact, has been polished. The entire vessel was covered with a thin pink-red slip and the neck is painted with irregular white patches.
